pull.title: PSBT: hash preimages fields
pull.body:
This implements the [bip174 input fields for hash preimages](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0174.mediawiki).
One motivation is that we will need those once we implement signing support for Miniscript descriptors.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#22558](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22558) (psbt: Taproot fields for PSBT by achow101)
* [#21283](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21283) (Implement BIP 370 PSBTv2 by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Code Review ACK e947d1d

Also tested manually `decodepsbt` with the PSBT from`test/functional/data/rpc_psbt.json`.

How can a PSBT be generate with the preimage fields ?

tACK e947d1d modulo duplicate test vector

Would be good to have a test that `decodepsbt` actually displays the new fields.

It looks like BIP174 test vectors were not updated when these new fields were added. You may want to make a PR to the BIP repo to add the ones you introduce here.

Paging Mr PSBT @achow101.

@w0xlt you'd have to use different software, because Bitcoin Core doesn't use these fields (yet!)
Thanks Sjors, i messed up the test vectors when cherry-picking from my version based on #17034. Corrected.

events.message: rpc: output all hash preimages in 'decodepsbt'

events.body:
reACK a9256dc

Tested with the PSBTs from `test/functional/data/rpc_psbt.json`.

Where (besides BIP 174) can I find more information about these fields? How are they generated and where are they used?
@w0xlt: some of it is explained here in a post by @apoelstra: https://lists.linuxfoundation.org/pipermail/bitcoin-dev/2019-March/016713.html

comments.body: This doesn't seem to have preimages, so why add it?

In 9ff68e38862106c827d40ab09731bd75a59d140c "psbt: implement hash preimages fields"

Hashes are almost always represented using `uint256`/`uint160` internally, so we should key by those instead.

comments.body:
In d1fdbd421737e6bdf1857fd68a79d69096d60b90 "rpc: output all hash preimages in 'decodepsbt'"

nit: While you're here, fix the typo

```suggestion
                                {RPCResult::Type::OBJ_DYN, "unknown", /*optional=*/ true, "The unknown input fields",
```

I've made them byte vectors because that's how they are represented in the Miniscript satisfier ([1](https://github.com/sipa/miniscript/blob/2e0734da14e85fb53cd5a96b98cfb7004e289202/bitcoin/script/miniscript.h#L326-L327), [2](https://github.com/sipa/miniscript/blob/2e0734da14e85fb53cd5a96b98cfb7004e289202/bitcoin/script/miniscript.h#L677-L696)).  Keying by each hash type would thus effectively result in >=2 needless copies (once when creating them here and n times when using them with the satisfier).

I don't think that really matters. Copying/creating/comparing a uint160/uint256 is very cheap (it's literally just 20 or 32 bytes in memory), while vector creation/copying is slow (it involves memory allocations, and some 40 bytes of overhead).
